meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a mouse in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The girl had mousy brown hair that reminded me of a little mouse.
meanings.sent2: The mousy movements of the small creature caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The mousy costume at the party was both cute and funny.
meanings.sent4: Her mousy demeanor in the meeting made her seem small and easily overlooked.
meanings.sent5: The mousy squeak of the toy mouse startled the cat.

meanings.sent1: He spoke in a mousy voice, barely audible in the crowded room.
meanings.sent2: The mousy child hid behind their parent when approached by strangers.
meanings.sent3: The mousy puppy hesitated before approaching the big dog.
meanings.sent4: Her mousy behavior at the party made her blend into the background.
meanings.sent5: The mousy student avoided eye contact with the teacher during the presentation.

meanings.definition: Dull or uninteresting in color or style.
meanings.sent1: The room was decorated in mousy shades of gray and beige.
meanings.sent2: The painting's mousy tones failed to capture anyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The mousy outfit she wore to the event was quickly forgotten.
meanings.sent4: His mousy writing lacked the vibrant energy of his earlier works.
meanings.sent5: The mousy wallpaper made the room feel drab and lifeless.
